page.title: 19The Chaplain:Glenalmond Coll
page.content: He enjoys the country and likes to be away from towns. He lives with his wife and mother in a school house. He has been at Glenalmond since April 1985. He has been here for too short a time to make concrete conclusions about it, though many things impress him including the individual care and attention put to things, but finds parts of the Chapel service unattractive, including the lack of involvment of boys. He finds it difficult to think what to put into the Divinity curriculum and likes to see the boys working out their own. He thinks the Bible is the wrong place to start teaching about Christianity and prefers working here to in a parish as he had to be a member of many organisations. He is concerned that so few boys attend Holy Communion, but enjoys having Chapel daily.
